Class dom.session.ClientView 

java.lang.Object
    |
    +----dom.session.View
            |
            +----dom.session.ClientView
Subclasses:
TestClientView
public class ClientView
extends View
Client View in 'star' topology. Implements the View functionality for 'non group manager' Views in a client-server (star) network topology.

Author:
Scott Lewis
See Also:
View, ServerView
Source Code:
ClientView.java

isServer

protected boolean isServer()
Called by DObjects to determine whether this view is a server view
Returns:
true if is a server view, false otherwise. Abstract because it has to be determined by subclasses

Throws:

Overrides:
queueSessionViewPacket in class View

reallyJoinGroup

protected void reallyJoinGroup(SessionViewID groupManager) throws java.io.IOException
Abstract method to really do work of making connection to remote process group. Should only be called from joinGroup, rather than directly. Assumes that view is not connected nor is waiting to connect. This method blocks until transport level connection is made (but group level connection is not yet established...that only happens when response is received from group manager).
Parameters:
target - the SessionViewID that identifies the target group manager for our connection
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if some problem making connection to remote group
Overrides:
reallyJoinGroup in class View

checkForAdmission

protected GroupAdmissionCheck checkForAdmission(SessionViewID id,
                                                SessionViewData data) throws java.io.IOException
Check for whether given SessionViewID, with given SessionViewData (sent with join request) should be allowed to enter the group. This method always should return a non-null instance of GroupAdmissionCheck. Subclasses will implement as necessary. Caller (GroupConnectionHandler. handleJoinMsg) should guarantee that this view object is the current group manager (e.g. ClientView will throw if not). The implementations of this method in subclasses should *always* either a) throw an exception; b) return a non-null GroupAdmissionCheck object.
Parameters:
id - the SessionViewID that is requesting group admission
data - the data that accompanies the id provided
Returns:
GroupAdmissionCheck object that contains the relevant result information
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if some problem with this message to begin with (i.e. ClientReceives this message).
Overrides:
checkForAdmission in class View
See Also:
GroupAdmissionCheck, handleJoinMsg

endConnecting

protected void endConnecting(SessionViewID groupManager,
                             int rank)
End our view's status of being in a 'connecting' state. This method is synchronized on the view object, so that a) the transition to a new state for this view (either connected or not) is atomic to this view; b) notifyAll() can be called so any waiting threads (joinGroup or leaveGroup methods on view) can be allowed to continue. If the groupManager is null, this means that we have left the group, and in that case we attempt to permanently close the connection to the group. If the groupManager is non-null, we have just entered a group successfully, and things may continue. NOTE: Any subclass override of this method should also be synchronized, and should call super.endConnecting when it has completed its own work.
Parameters:
groupManager - the SessionViewID of our group manager. If null, this means that we have successfully left a group. If non-null, we have successfully been added to a group
rank - our rank in the group (provided by manager)
Overrides:
endConnecting in class View

closeConnection

protected void closeConnection(ReliableConnection connection)
Forcibly close the connection given. This is called to deal with an exception reported by the connection's thread. For this client class, the superclass closeConnection is called, then the listmanager is updated, then the group manager is set to null.
Parameters:
connection - the ReliableConnection in question
Overrides:
closeConnection in class View

forwardFromRemoteViewExcluding

protected void forwardFromRemoteViewExcluding(SessionViewID fromID,
                                              SessionViewID excluded,
                                              int msg,
                                              SessionViewData data)
Forwards msg to all group members, using the 'fromID' parameter to specify where this message is from. This is implemented by the server only for fanout. This does all fanout of all messages! Client implements as a nop. NOTE: *Assumes that group membership does not change during this operation*...i.e. synchronization on list manager should be guaranteed before this is called.
Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID to put in 'fromID' field of the packet
excluded - a SessionViewID to exclude. If null, everyone is sent the message
msg - the SessionViewMsg to send
data - the SessionViewData to send with the message
Overrides:
forwardFromRemoteViewExcluding in class View

forwardFromRemoteViewToRemoteView

protected void forwardFromRemoteViewToRemoteView(SessionViewID fromID,
                                                 SessionViewID toID,
                                                 int msg,
                                                 SessionViewData data)
Forwards msg to one specific group member, using the 'fromID' parameter to specify where this message is from. This is implemented by the server (only). This does message routing.
Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID to put in 'fromID' field of the packet
toID - the SessionViewID to put in the 'toID' field of the packet
msg - the SessionViewMsg to send
data - the SessionViewData to send with the message
Overrides:
forwardFromRemoteViewToRemoteView in class View
